definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: A boaster and a liar are cousins.
Those guys have to be lying.
She would rather tell the truth than lie.
sentences.chinese: 她宁愿讲实话而不愿说谎。

sentences.english: If I try, never give it up, if I try, would I lie to you?
sentences.chinese: 只要我想要尝试，我将永不言弃，我会对你说谎吗？

sentences.english: But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues;
sentences.chinese: 他们却用口谄媚他，用舌向他说谎。

sentences.english: The mendacious beggar told a different tale of woe at every house.
sentences.chinese: 那个好说谎的乞丐在每家说不同的悲哀故事。
健谈者通常都是善于说谎的人。

sentences.english: So, you must have to observe for the first symptom.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你必须观察这些说谎的第一征兆。

sentences.english: She degraded herself by cheating and telling lies.
You're lying to jazz up your otherwise miserable life.
sentences.chinese: 你说谎调解你的悲惨生活。

sentences.english: The boy has a shortcoming, which is telling lies and playing tricks on others.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子有一个坏毛病，就是喜欢说谎，爱搞恶作剧。

sentences.english: This will make the liar at ease.
sentences.chinese: 这样就会让说谎者放松。

sentences.english: Those that tell lies and have bad hearts are not able to see this fine cloth.
sentences.chinese: 那些说谎的和有坏的心的人是不能看见这精美的布的。

sentences.english: Hillary was a good choice, she can tell a lie without even blinking.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里是一个不错的选择，丫简直说谎不带眨眼的。

sentences.english: “Never lie” also can be extended as “Don’t mask truths.
sentences.chinese: “不要说谎”也可以引申为“不掩饰真相”。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
